abstract_summ: Towards the dynamical models based on ODEs, it is observed that the SEIR-QD and SEIR-PO models generally show a better performance than SIR, SEIR and SEIR-AHQ models on the COVID-19 epidemics, whose success could be attributed to the inclusion of self-protection and quarantine, and a proper trade-off between model complexity and fitting accuracy.We extended the SIR epidemiological model to a novel model we call the PECAIQR model.In this paper we survey the different models proposed in the literature, assembling a list of 36 model structures and assessing their ability to provide reliable information.Epidemic dynamics are commonly analysed using compartmental models, and many variations of such models have been used for analysing and predicting the evolution of the COVID-19 pandemic.Towards the ODE models, the SEIR-QD and SEIR-PO models are shown to be suitable for modeling the COVID-19 epidemics, whose success could be attributed to the inclusion of self-protection and quarantine.
title_summ: A Novel Approach for Estimating the Final Outcome of Global Diseases Like COVID-19Rational evaluation of various epidemic models based on the COVID-19 data of ChinaA Time-Dependent SEIRD Model for Forecasting the COVID-19 Transmission DynamicsStructural Identifiability and Observability of Compartmental Models of the COVID-19 PandemicPECAIQR: A Model for Infectious Disease Applied to the Covid-19 EpidemicRational evaluation of various epidemic models based on the COVID-19 data of ChinaRemarks on a data-driven model for predicting the course of COVID-19 epidemic
title_abstract_phrases: Towards the dynamical models based on ODEs, it is observed that the SEIR-QD and SEIR-PO models generally show a better performance than SIR, SEIR and SEIR-AHQ models on the COVID-19 epidemics, whose success could be attributed to the inclusion of self-protection and quarantine, and a proper trade-off between model complexity and fitting accuracy.Towards the ODE models, the SEIR-QD and SEIR-PO models are shown to be suitable for modeling the COVID-19 epidemics, whose success could be attributed to the inclusion of self-protection and quarantine.It is supposed to be a reasonable estimate which can help the governments in planning for emergencies such as ICU requirements, PPEs, hospitalizations, and so on as the infection is going to be prevalent for some time to comeStructural Identifiability and Observability of Compartmental Models of the COVID-19 PandemicThe recent coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak has dramatically increased the public awareness and appreciation of the utility of dynamic models.In this paper, based on the public COVID-19 data of seven provinces/cities in China reported during the spring of 2020, we make a systematical investigation on the forecast ability of eight widely used empirical functions, four statistical inference methods and five dynamical models widely used in the literature.Based on the public COVID-19 data of seven provinces/cities in China reported during the spring of 2020, we make a systematical investigation on the forecast ability of eight widely used empirical functions, four statistical inference methods and five dynamical models.
